title: Treating Wounds in Radioactive Environments
brief: Special procedures for treating injuries in nuclear fallout conditions.
steps: Step 1: Cover all wounds immediately to prevent contamination and entry of radioactive particles.
Step 2: For beta radiation burns, wash thoroughly first, then treat as ordinary burns.
Step 3: Take extra measures to prevent infection in all wounds.
Step 4: Practice rigorous personal hygiene to prevent respiratory infections and colds.
Step 5: Clean shelter site using a branch or disposable object to remove contaminated materials.
Step 6: Extend cleaned area at least 1.5 meters beyond your shelter area.
Step 7: Wash body thoroughly with soap and water, even if water may be contaminated.
Step 8: If no water available, wipe exposed skin with clean cloth or uncontaminated dirt from below surface.
warnings: Body will be extremely sensitive to infections due to radiation effects on blood chemistry.
Beta burns appear similar to fire burns but result from penetrating radiation.
Even contaminated water is better than no cleaning for removing radioactive particles.
